title: BTS fans celebrate Jimin's birthday in style as Suga tells him to 'grow tall
text:
Fans are sharing the love for the birthday boy (Picture: WireImage)

BTS fans have been celebrating Jimin’s 24th birthday by getting a whole host of hashtags trending for him.

They definitely know how to take over social media.

ARMYs around the world have been wishing the K-Pop hero a happy birthday, sharing sweet messages, photos and videos of the star.

‘#HappyBirthdayJimin,’ and ‘#JiminBirthday,’ are just two of the hashtags used to celebrate the big day.

The shade of it all (Picture: Twitter/BTS_twt)

Meanwhile, BTS’ official Twitter account has shared some adorable snaps of the star to wish him a happy birthday as the members shared their own messages for him.

Fans are assuming that Suga brought the shade with one message urging the star to ‘grow tall this year’, while another post read: ‘Happy birthday to our pretty Jimin. Let’s eat delicious food in Korea.’

Sounds like a plan.

The band were performing their first ever concert in Saudi Arabia when they mentioned Jimin’s birthday, with the main man telling the crowd: ‘Tonight is truly a night that I won’t be able to forget.’

According to Soompi, he added: ‘Thinking of seeing you, I had forgotten it was my birthday. Thank you for the happy birthday wishes, and it’s a good day, being able to spend my birthday with my fellow BTS members. Thank you.’

So sweet!

Messages have been pouring in from fans (Pictures: Twitter)

Meanwhile, the messages from fans have been pouring in.

‘In honor of Jimin‘s birthday I will get absolutely s***faced every single night of this long weekend,’ one said. ‘Happy birthday you funky little demon.’

‘JIMIN OWN ALL THE WORLDWIDE TRENDS OMG HIS POWER,’ another pointed out.

Meanwhile, one more fan told him: ‘Happy Birthday to Jimin I hope hes getting spoilt today.’

Fans have had a lot to celebrate this week after the boys, who recently returned from their break, vowed to stay at the top of K-Pop for another decade.

Suga told The Hollywood Reporter: ‘As long as our bodies hold up, we’ll be doing the same thing in 10 years.’

While Jimin said: ‘We’re not really compelling each other to keep this going. It’s nothing like that.

‘We just have so much fun together singing and dancing that we want it to continue.’
